title: Christian Lealiifano who overcame leukemia to make Rugby World Cup shares heartfelt moment with son
text:
Christian Lealiifano shared an emotional moment with his son in the aftermath of Australia's crushing defeat against England after overcoming a battle with leukemia just to even make it to the Rugby World Cup.

Australia suffered a 40-16 defeat in the quarter-finals, but that did not stop Lealiifano, who was told he may never play rugby again after being diagnosed three years ago, savouring the moment with his loved one.

The fly-half kicked three penalties out of a possible three in the first half as Australia kept themselves in the game, but England eventually proved too strong for the Aussies.

Christian Lealiifano shared an emotional moment with his son after a battle with leukemia

Christian Lealiifano, a player who has overcome a huge amount to be back playing rugby at the top level, shares a special moment with his son after a tough loss to England in Oita. #RWC2019 #ENGvAUS pic.twitter.com/nE4hlAs4Wm — Rugby World Cup (@rugbyworldcup) October 19, 2019

The tweet, posted by Rugby World Cup, captured the heartfelt moment after the game, showing that ultimately some things are bigger than a game of rugby.

Lealiifano made his debut for the Australia against the British and Irish Lions in 2013, but his promising career had been put on hold.

His comeback to rugby is a fairy-tale in itself after two bouts of chemotherapy and a bone marrow transplant but to return as a crucial player for the Aussies in a Rugby World Cup is a remarkable journey.

Japan 2019 is the Aussie star's first World Cup, after arriving on the scene too late in 2011 and missing out on final selection in 2015.
description: Christian Lealiifano shared an emotional moment with his son in the aftermath of Australia's crushing defeat against England, after overcoming a battle with leukemia just to be at the Rugby World Cup.
